Previously, D-secoestrone triazole ( 3) was proved to significantly increase maximum rate of tubulin polymerisation
15 . Based on structural similarity between compound 3 and the newly synthesised 12a owing the lowest IC 50 value against ovarian cancer cell line A2780, 12a was supposed to influence microtubule formation. To demonstrate our hypothesis, 12a was subjected to a cell-free, in vitro tubulin polymerisation assay in two different concentrations (125 and 250 µM). The calculated maximum rate of tubulin polymerisation was increased by our test compound which was significant when 12a was added in 250 µM concentration to the reaction mixture ( Figure 4). Paclitaxel, the positive control agent recommended by the manufacturer, evoked a threefold increase in V max ( Figure 4).
